channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 6 Pakistani soldiers killed in militant attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
item.description: Militants attacked a security checkpoint in Kurram district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, killing six Pakistani security personnel and wounding seven. This incident follows recent sectarian clashes in the region, though it is reportedly unrelated. Separately, last month, Balochistan separatists attacked a border post, killing seven soldiers, highlighting ongoing security challenges in Pakistan.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: RFK Jr's bizarre questionnaire for hiring people: Sexual experience, sixth sense
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., poised to become Donald Trump's health secretary pending Senate confirmation, has a weird 90-minute questionnaire for people who want to work with him. The applicants will have to select pre-written responses about sexual experience, clairvoyance etc. The questionnaire should be filled only when the applicants are well-rested, well-fed and won't be disturbed for 90 minutes, it stipulated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UnitedHealth Group CEO reacts to 'celebration' after Brian Thompson killing: 'Highly disrespectful'
item.description: The CEO of UnitedHealth Group, the mother company of UnitedHealthcare, Andrew Witty condemned the inappropriate comments being said on social media following the murder of Brian Thompson. Witty urged employees to avoid engaging with the media. ​"I'd like to give you little bit of advice around the media…My strong advice and request to everybody is just don't engage with the media. If you're approached, I would recommend not responding and, if necessary, simply refer them to our own media organization.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Goal is to overthrow Assad regime,' says HTS as rebels advance offensive in Syria
item.description: Syrian rebels, including a powerful Islamist alliance, have seized Daraa, "the cradle of the revolution," and other key cities, dealing significant blows to President Assad's forces. The rebels are advancing on Homs, raising regional instability concerns. While celebrating their victories, Islamist rebel leaders attempt to reassure minorities amidst fears of sectarian violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why this UCLA student is suing two California docs for giving her a double mastectomy at 14
item.description: A 20-year-old Californian, Kaya Clementine Breen, is suing two doctors and a hospital, alleging they prematurely transitioned her gender as a minor. Breen claims she received inadequate information about risks and irreversible procedures. This coincides with a Supreme Court case challenging Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors, highlighting the national debate surrounding this issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump releases 'Fight, Fight, Fight' perfumes and colognes
item.description: Donald Trump launched new perfume and cologne lines, "Fight Fight Fight" and "Victory," priced from $199 to $298. He promoted them on Truth Social as representing winning. This follows his recent luxury watch release and existing product lines like the "God Bless the USA" Bible and "Never-Surrender" sneakers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You said this would not happen and it did': Karine Jean-Pierre slammed in press briefing over Hunter Biden's pardon
item.description: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre faced intense questioning over President Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter. Jean-Pierre's previous denials of such a possibility were highlighted, and her cited poll data was challenged for accuracy. The pardon followed Hunter Biden's guilty pleas and convictions on tax and gun charges, sparking controversy and social media backlash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US national police association backs Trump’s pick Kash Patel for FBI director role
item.description: The National Police Association (NPA) endorsed Kash Patel, President-elect Trump's pick for FBI Director. The NPA cited Patel's national security, legal, and public service experience, highlighting his roles in the Trump administration and as a federal prosecutor. However, Patel's selection has drawn criticism due to his lack of FBI experience and concerns about political motivations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Sky Elements sets new US record with largest drone show over Texas
item.description: Sky Elements shattered their own drone show record, flying 5,000 drones over Mansfield, Texas, for a dazzling pre-Christmas display. The Thanksgiving and Christmas-themed show featured a giant turkey, a gingerbread village, and Santa Claus, earning them their 11th Guinness World Record. The spectacle was a collaboration with UVify, showcasing cutting-edge drone technology.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Far-right influencer Nick Fuentes charged with battery, posts own mugshot on social media
item.description: Far-right influencer Nick Fuentes, 26, was charged with battery after allegedly assaulting 57-year-old Marla Rose outside his Berwyn, Illinois home on November 10. Fuentes allegedly pepper-sprayed Rose, stole her phone, and yelled expletives. He was released after being fingerprinted and is due in court December 19.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson murder: FBI offers $50K reward for leads on gunman
item.description: Brian Thompson, CEO of UnitedHealthcare, was fatally shot outside a Manhattan hotel. The masked gunman fled the scene and is believed to have left New York City by bus. Surveillance footage tracked the suspect's movements before and after the attack. Police found potential clues and are investigating a possible link to a book about insurance claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden's bad hair day draws ghostly comparisons at White House Christmas event
item.description: President Biden's unexpectedly long, static-charged hair at the White House Christmas tree lighting ceremony drew attention and social media comparisons to characters from "A Christmas Carol." Braving the unusually cold December evening, he spoke of peace, light, and the holiday spirit, referencing "O Holy Night" and wishing America a Merry Christmas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Princess Kate Middleton hosts 'Together at Christmas' service, her first major public event after cancer diagnosis
item.description: Princess Kate returned to public life, hosting her annual Christmas carol service at Westminster Abbey after battling cancer. The service, attended by family, royals, and community members, emphasized love and empathy. Kate's appearance marks a significant step in her recovery following chemotherapy and surgery earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Donald Trump vanquished him, Biden, Harris': Conservatives slam Obama in first post-elections speech
item.description: Former President Barack Obama addressed the Obama Foundation's Democracy Forum, discussing political polarization and pluralism after the Democrats' 2024 election loss. His remarks, emphasizing the importance of coalition-building and rejecting purity tests, drew criticism from conservatives on social media, who accused him of hypocrisy and exacerbating political divisions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: TikTok ban looms in US: What it means for users and creators
item.description: A US appeals court upheld a law requiring TikTok to separate from its Chinese parent company, ByteDance, or face a ban. TikTok plans to appeal to the Supreme Court. While President-elect Trump previously supported a ban, he now aims to "save TikTok," adding complexity to the situation. ByteDance opposes selling TikTok, and a sale without its core algorithm is unlikely.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'He was very vocal': Melania reveals how Barron helped Trump secure victory
item.description: Melania Trump revealed Barron Trump's significant role in his father's 2024 presidential victory. The 18-year-old advised his father to engage with Gen Z through podcasts and online platforms. This strategy, including appearances on shows like "The Joe Rogan Experience", resonated with young voters and contributed to Trump's success, earning Barron acclaim from the campaign and supporters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Romania's top court scraps presidential election
item.description: Romania's constitutional court annulled the presidential election due to allegations of Russian interference favoring the far-right frontrunner, Calin Georgescu. The court cited irregularities and violations throughout the process. Incumbent President Iohannis will remain until a new election date is set. The decision sparked controversy, with some condemning it as an attack on democracy while others expressed relief.

item.title: 'Very sorry for causing anxiety': South Korea's President Yoon apologises for declaring martial law
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol apologized for declaring martial law, acknowledging public anxiety. Facing an impeachment vote, he expressed remorse but stopped short of resigning, leaving his future to his party. Yoon assured the nation there would be no further martial law declarations and accepted accountability for his actions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Late-night K-drama leaves democracy in suspense
Trump's Middle East envoy engages in high-stakes talks to end Gaza conflict and release Israeli hostages
item.description: Trump's Middle East envoy, Steven Witkoff, engaged in pre-inauguration talks with Qatari and Israeli officials, aiming to secure a Gaza ceasefire and the release of Israeli hostages held by Hamas. Trump demanded their release by January 20. Hamas seeks a permanent ceasefire and Israeli withdrawal, facing resistance from Netanyahu's coalition. Mediation efforts are ongoing amidst the 14-month conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
